attributes.comment:
I am a business person and believe that rate increases are understandable at
times. Everyone understands that prices go up. However, one increase of over
65% is very high. It seems that our government is talking out of both sides of their
mouth. Allowing a $10,000 tax credit for adoptions but then proposing to increase
the rates for filing and forms by over 65% is taking away from that generous tax
credit. Adoption is a blessing for all involved. Families able to grow by opening
their hearts and their homes and children being able to grow into responsible,
thriving adults who will contribute to make a better society. The alternative of
adoption is orphanages and foster care that again takes money away from the
government to fund these programs. So why penalize the people who are trying to
provide a home for these children by increasing their fess by over 65%? This
rational is not understandable and doesn't make good sense to a business
person. The idea that this has been proposed is crazy but what is much more
unimaginable is that this could actually happen. Please, consider all of the
consequences when you look at passing this increase. Isn't there somewhere
else you can increase prices and leave the adoption rates alone. Aren't the costs
for adoption already too high? Aren't we helping the economy by taking on the
burden of providing for a child that has been abandoned or relinquished up to the
government to take care of? Don't penalize us and make it even harder for families
to adopt.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Nancy N. Holland
